players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Charlie was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Diana: "Bob is the mafia. Charlie is dead, and I investigated Bob last night. He is the mafioso."
You: "I find it strange that Charlie is dead so early in the game. Let's remain vigilant and make informed decisions based on evidence."
Bob: "I agree with Alice that we should focus on gathering evidence before making any accusations. Let's be cautious and consider all possibilities before casting any votes."

Bob: "Let us not jump to conclusions based on assumptions or fear. We should remain open-minded and focus on gathering more evidence before making any accusations. I believe it is important that we work together as a team and trust each other until there is concrete proof of wrongdo..."
Diana: "Bob is the mafia. Charlie is dead, and I investigated Bob last night. He is the mafioso."

You: "I believe it is important for us to remain calm and focused on gathering evidence before making any accusations. Let's remember that assumptions and fear should not be the basis of our decisions. We should work together as a team and trust each other until there is concrete proof..."
Votes: Alice voted for Bob (the vote was cast randomly because of a failed format), Bob voted for Alice, Diana voted for Bob
Bob was arrested

players.name: Diana
memory: You're Diana, the detective.

Charlie was found dead.
You investigated Bob and discovered that they are the mafioso.
Day 1 begins.

Alice: "I find it strange that Charlie is dead so early in the game. Let's remain vigilant and make informed decisions based on evidence."
Bob: "I agree with Alice that we should focus on gathering evidence before making any accusations. Let's be cautious and consider all possibilities before casting any votes."

Bob: "Let us not jump to conclusions based on assumptions or fear. We should remain open-minded and focus on gathering more evidence before making any accusations. I believe it is important that we work together as a team and trust each other until there is concrete proof of wrongdo..."
